While I am not sure that cracking your knuckles is all together not bad for you, I do know that the common idea that it causes arthritis is false. 
Donald Unger spent 60 years cracking the knuckles on his left hand but not on his right each day after his mother told him it would cause arthritis. After 60 years there was no difference in both hands thus disproving the idea. When he found this out he said his somewhat famous words “Mother, I know you can hear me. Mother, you were wrong!''
